Utilities (fd_greens.general_utils)

reverse_qubit_order(array: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Reverses qubit order in a 1D or 2D array.

Parameters

array – The array on which qubit order is to be reversed.

Returns

array_new – The new array with qubit order reversed.

unitary_equal(unitary1: Union[cirq.circuits.circuit.Circuit, numpy.ndarray], unitary2: Union[cirq.circuits.circuit.Circuit, numpy.ndarray], initial_state_0: bool = True) → bool[source]

Checks if two unitaries are equal up to a phase factor.

Parameters

  • unitary1 – The first unitary in circuit or array form.

  • unitary2 – The second unitary in circuit or array form.

  • initial_state_0 – Whether to assume the initial state to be the all 0 state.

Returns

is_equal – Whether the two unitaries are equal up to a phase.

histogram_to_array(histogram: dict, n_qubits: Optional[int] = None, base: int = 2, normalize: bool = True) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Converts a bitstring histogram to a numpy array.

Parameters

  • histogram – The histogram from simulators or experiments. Keys of the histogram can either be strings, such as '01', or tuples of integers, such as (0, 1).

  • n_qubits – Number of qubits.

  • base – The base in integer conversion. Defaults to 2 for qubits.

  • normalize – Whether to normalize the sum of the bitstring counts to 1.

Returns

array – The bitstring array from the histogram.

get_gate_counts(circuit: Union[cirq.circuits.circuit.Circuit, cirq.ops.moment.Moment], *, criterion: Callable[[Union[cirq.ops.raw_types.Operation, cirq.ops.op_tree.OpTree]], bool] = <function <lambda>>, num_qubits: Optional[int] = None) → int[source]

Returns the count of gates satisfying a certain criterion.

Only one of num_qubits and criterion should be passed in. If num_qubits is given, count the number of gates with num_qubits number of qubits. Otherwise counting is performed with criterion, for example criterion=op.num_qubits() == 2 counts all two-qubit gates. Defaults to counting all non-Z-rotation gates.

Parameters

  • circuit – The circuit on which to return gate counts.

  • criterion – The criterion of gates to be counted.

  • num_qubits – Number of qubits in gates to be counted.

Returns

count – Number of gates satisfying a certain criterion.

split_circuit_across_moment(circuit: cirq.circuits.circuit.Circuit, moment_split: cirq.ops.moment.Moment) → List[cirq.circuits.circuit.Circuit][source]

Splits a circuit across a certain moment.

Parameters

  • circuit – The circuit to be split.

  • moment_split – A moment used to split the circuit.

Returns

circuits – A list of circuits split at moments.

get_non_z_locations(circuit: Union[cirq.circuits.circuit.Circuit, List[List[str]]]) → List[int][source]

Returns the non-Z locations of a circuit.

Parameters

circuit – A circuit in either Cirq circuit form or Qtrl strings form.

Returns

locations – A list of integers indicating the non-Z locations.

get_circuit_depth(circuit: Union[cirq.circuits.circuit.Circuit, List[List[str]]]) → int[source]

Returns the circuit depth by excluding Z and CP gates.

Parameters

circuit – A circuit in either Cirq circuit form or Qtrl strings form.

Returns

depth – The depth of the circuit.

get_n_simultaneous_cz(qtrl_strings: List[List[str]]) → int[source]

Returns the number of simultaneous CZ gates.

split_simultaneous_cz(circuit: Union[cirq.circuits.circuit.Circuit, List[List[str]]]) → None[source]

Splits simultaneous CZ/CS/CSDs onto different moments.

Parameters

circuit – The circuit in either Cirq circuit form or Qtrl strings form.

combine_simultaneous_cz(circuit: Union[cirq.circuits.circuit.Circuit, List[List[str]]]) → None[source]

Combines simultaneous CZ/CS/CSDs into the same moment.

Parameters

circuit – The circuit in either Cirq circuit form or Qtrl strings form.

print_circuit_statistics(circuit: cirq.circuits.circuit.Circuit, latex_form: bool = True) → None[source]

Prints out circuit statistics.

Parameters

circuit – The circuit on which statistics are to be printed.

get_bloch_vector(state: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Returns the Bloch vector of a state.

get_fidelity(state1: numpy.ndarray, state2: numpy.ndarray, purify: bool = False) → float[source]

Returns the fidelity between two states.

Parameters

  • state1 – The first state.

  • state2 – The second state.

  • purify – Whether to purify density matrices.

Returns

fidelity – The fidelity between two states.

project_density_matrix(density_matrix: numpy.ndarray, normalize: bool = True) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Projects a density matrix to its closest positive semi-definite equilvalent.

purify_density_matrix(density_matrix: numpy.ndarray, niter: int = 10) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Purifies a density matrix using McWeeney purification.

Parameters

  • density_matrix – The density matrix to be purified.

  • niter – Number of iterations used in the purification algorithm.

Returns

density_matrix – The density matrix after purification.

state_tomography(result_array: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Quantum state tomography.

Parameters

result_array – The array that contains normalized bitstring counts.

Returns

density_matrix – The density matrix obtained from quantum state tomography.

two_qubit_state_tomography(result_array: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray

Quantum state tomography.

Parameters

result_array – The array that contains normalized bitstring counts.

Returns

density_matrix – The density matrix obtained from quantum state tomography.

quantum_state_tomography(h5file: Union[h5py._hl.files.File, dict], n_qubits: int, circuit_label: Optional[str] = None, suffix: Optional[str] = None, ancilla_index: int = 0, reverse: bool = False) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Quantum state tomography.

Parameters

  • h5file – The HDF5 file or dictionary that contains the bitstring counts.

  • n_qubits – Number of tomographed qubits.

  • circuit_label – The circuit label.

  • suffix – The suffix associated with the circuit.

  • ancilla_index – The ancilla index used to slice the density matrix.
